snippet: A new federal proposal on mass advertising would make stock investing even more dangerous.
abstract: Editorial decries a new federal proposal on mass advertising that would make stock investing even more dangerous; charges that the Securities and Exchange Commission has made matters worse by failing to put measures in place to protect everyday investors from fraud; asserts that while the SEC has no choice but to lift the ban on ads for private stock offerings, it does have leeway to write rules to decrease the threat to investors.
lead_paragraph: A new federal proposal on mass advertising would make stock investing even more dangerous.

headline.seo: Risky and Getting Riskier for Investors
